financial_benefits.description: Costa Rica does not impose local income tax on foreign-sourced income for digital nomads.
Costa Rica offers a relatively low cost of living compared to many Western countries.

lifestyle_benefits.description: Enjoy a tropical climate with warm temperatures year-round.
Costa Rica offers a high quality of life with beautiful natural landscapes and rich biodiversity.

additional_benefits.description: Costa Ricans, known as 'Ticos,' are known for their friendliness and hospitality.
The country is known for its biodiversity and beautiful landscapes.

key_consideration: Costa Rica's Digital Nomad Visa allows remote workers to live and work in the country for up to one year with no local tax on foreign income. Your income must be stable, in other words, you must be able to demonstrate that you consistently earn the minimum amount. Please bear this in mind.
action_comment: Consider Costa Rica for its balance of work and leisure opportunities.
tax_residency_trigger_details: You are considered a tax resident if you stay for longer than 183 days in a calendar year.

visas.key_consideration: The visa is renewable for an additional year if you meet the requirements and have spent at least 80 days in Costa Rica during the first year. Your income must be stable, in other words, you must be able to demonstrate that you consistently earn the minimum amount. Please bear this in mind.

income_requirement.misc_details: Minimum monthly income requirement: $3,000 for individuals and $4,000 for families.

application_fee.details: The application fee includes $100 for the government application and $90 for the issuance of the immigration document.

visas.renewability_details: The visa is renewable for an additional year if you meet the requirements and have spent at least 80 days in Costa Rica during the first year.
visas.special_tax_regime_details: Digital nomads are exempt from paying income tax on foreign-sourced income.
visas.permanent_residency_details: The digital nomad visa does not lead to permanent residency.

special_regimes.name: Digital Nomad Visa
special_regimes.benefit: Exemption from income tax on foreign-sourced income.
eligibility: Proof of employment or self-employment outside Costa Rica.
Proof of payments for the past 12 months showing that the digital nomad receives a stable monthly income of at least $3,000 for an individual, or $4,000 per month for a family.
Health insurance for the duration of the stay.
Proof of accommodation for the duration of your stay
An employment contract or freelancer agreements

required_documents: Application form signed by the applicant or their representative.

Receipt confirming payment to the Government in the amount of one hundred US dollars ($100.00) or the equivalent amount in Costa Rican colones at the reference exchange rate of the Central Bank of Costa Rica.

A copy of the photo page of the foreign national’s valid passport, which contains their photograph and biographical information, as well as the page containing the Costa Rican entry stamp if the applicant is already in Costa Rica.

Bank statements accompanied by an affidavit declaring that the statements have been requested and obtained from the corresponding financial institution. These statements must provide evidence of income and indicate that the individual has received payments for work during the previous year from outside Costa Rica of at least $3,000.00 per month at the official sale rate determined by the Central Bank of Costa Rica, or four thousand US dollars ($4,000.00) for a family.

Or the applicant may submit a certification of the bank statements issued by a public accountant or notary public, if the procedure is completed in Costa Rica, or by the counterparts of such professionals abroad in accordance with the legislation of the respective country. This certification is the only component that must be accompanied by the respective consular legalization or apostille.

special_regimes.name: Digital Nomad Visa
special_regimes.benefit: Exemption from income tax on foreign-sourced income.
eligibility: Non-EU citizens – EU citizens do not need a residency permit as being part of the EU automatically grants them the right to live in the country.
Valid Passport – You must ensure that your passport is valid at least 3 months after the visa term.

Proof of consistent, monthly income from employers or clients outside Croatia of at least 16,907 HRK (~$2,700). In lieu of proof of income, proof of funds instead of 202,890 HRK (~$32,000) is acceptable.
Proof of health insurance in Croatia for the duration of the stay.
A certified background check from your home country. Or the last country that you lived in for more than a year if it was not your home country. American applicants will need a FBI background check.
A lease agreement or booking confirmation (hotels or hostels are acceptable) of your address in Croatia. If this is not a long term lease, you can later change your address at a police station.

required_documents: Copy of passport
Proof of employment by a foreign employer or foreign clients for contractors
Proof of sufficient income
Past 3 months of bank statements
Proof of long-term lease or temporary residence address in Croatia
Criminal background check (FBI background check for Americans)
Submit the application (online or in-person)
